alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 07 at 4:06AM MDT until May 07 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...LONG DURATION RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS FROM 11 AM SATURDAY TO 10 PM MDT SUNDAY EVENING DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, ABOVE AVERAGE WARMTH AND A VERY UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT ALL OTHER AREAS FROM 11 AM TO 10 PM MDT TODAY AND AGAIN 10 AM TO 10 PM MDT SUNDAY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, ABOVE AVERAGE WARMTH AND A VERY UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IS IN EFFECT AREA WIDE FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, ABOVE AVERAGE WARMTH AND A VERY UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .An exceptionally dangerous and likely historic stretch of critical fire weather is on tap beginning today and lasting each day through at least to the middle of next week. Widespread strong west to southwest winds, above normal warmth, many hours of single- digit humidities, and an unstable atmosphere will exist through Monday. The Northeast Highlands could continue with critical fire weather conditions from late this morning through Sunday evening, with little or no break tonight. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING AND FOR THE SAME TIMES SUNDAY FOR ALL BUT THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR ALL AREAS... * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau and Highlands, West Central Highlands, North Central and Sandia, Manzano and Gallinas Mountains, Middle Rio Grande Valley, Northeast and East Central Plains from 11 AM MDT today through 10 PM MDT this evening. Critical conditions will redevelop again Sunday morning through Sunday evening, and again Monday morning through Monday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 35 mph with gusts of 40 to 50 mph today. Southwest winds of 25 to 35 mph with occasional gusts of 45 to 55 mph on Sunday and Monday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 4 to 15 percent each day with long durations of single digit relative humidities. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly and will be hard to control. Long range spotting and extreme fire behavior will be possible. Outdoor burning should not be done.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warnings. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands
